12152003  o0002  7 1162017 editors note at the citys request the schedule of regulations from app a  1412 was deleted lot types lot types article xv  planned unit developments footnotes  6  editors note o012  1exh b adopted dec 17 2001 amended by deleting app a art xv  151159 and enacted a new app a art xv  1511510 as set out herein the former app a art xv pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  adopted dec 2 1996   adopted dec 20 1999   adopted feb 21 2000 151  purpose and intent the planned unit development is a concept which encourages improved design in the development of land providing relief from strict compliance with district requirements which are designed for conventional developments but which may inhibit creative development of property unfavorably impact on property with unique features or cause hardship or complication for desirable but unconventional development where such relief will result in greater utility andor enhanced amenities for the public in order that the following objectives may be obtained a provide environmental design and preservation of natural features of the site in the development of land that would be more desirable than what is possible strict application of this ordinance b diversification in the uses permitted and variation in the relationship of uses structures open spaces and heights of structures in developments conceived as cohesive unified projects c provisions for functional aesthetic and beneficial use of open areas d allow for phasing of development to encourage comprehensive project design and review e shall not be detrimental to or endanger the public health safety morals comfort or general welfare o012  1exh b 12172001 152  application and interpretation a the provisions of this article shall apply to all planned unit developments in the city of west chicago in interpreting and applying the provisions of this article planned unit developments will be held to the minimum requirements for the promotion and effectuation of the purposes set forth in section 151 of this article b except as otherwise provided for herein all planned unit developments shall be developed in accordance with all applicable provisions of this code when this article imposes restrictions or requirements greater than those imposed by any other provisions of this code the provisions of this article shall control c nothing herein shall interfere with abrogate or annul any easement covenant deed restrictions or agreement between parties which impose restrictions greater than those imposed by this article d based on submission of a high quality site plan planned unit developments may vary from strict compliance with provisions of this zoning ordinance or deviate from strict compliance with the provisions of the subdivision regulations except for minimum standards set forth herein any proposed variance or deviation shall be considered based on the following factors 1 that any variance or deviation is justified by an independent analysis 2 that the physical conditions of the property cause a hardship in compliance with code requirements 3 that the proposed variance or deviation results in a cohesive high quality development 4 that any reduction from minimum requirements are offset by sufficiently exceeding zoning standards elsewhere in the development to provide a greater benefit to the community e based on submission of a high quality site plan permission may be granted for construction of a planned unit development with two 2 or more principal buildings or uses on a single zoning lot any mixed use development shall follow both the residential and nonresidential standards set forth in this ordinance o012  1exh b 12172001 153  procedure for planned unit development a preapplication and sketch plans 1 any owner or agent with respect to land within or adjacent to the city may submit to the administrator a sketch plan setting forth the information required in section 156 of this article in order to obtain the views of the appropriate city officials so as to provide such owner andor agent guidance in the development of their property under the terms of this article 2 the administrator shall review said sketch plan and informally discuss the merits andor problems of the proposed development b preliminary plan and plat stage 1 following the sketch plan and preapplication stage if utilized the owner or his representative shall submit to the administrator a completed application for a special use permit for a planned unit development and copies of the associated preliminary plan and plat containing such information and in such form as required in section 156 of this article as part of any such application the applicant may request the ability to submit final planned unit development plans and plats and develop the planned unit development in phases 2 the administrator shall refer said plan and plats to the zoning board of appeals for public hearing and review and to any other staff deemed necessary in order to provide review and comment to the zoning board of appeals 3 the zoning board of appeals shall after public notice in the manner required for special use requests as set forth in this ordinance hold a public hearing on the application for a special use permit for the planned unit development and the preliminary plan and plat and shall recommend to the city council approval approval with modifications or denial of the application based on specific findings of fact the zoning board of appeals may call any additional witnesses andor receive independent testimony as it may deem necessary and may continue said hearing from time to time in order to explore all outstanding questions and to achieve thorough findings of fact 4 the city council shall receive the recommendations of the zoning board of appeals and other recommendations of staff as have been requested and shall either approve approve with modification or deny the application if the city council elects to approve the application in any form the city council shall by ordinance approve the preliminary plan and plat and grant a special use permit for a planned unit development said ordinance may authorize in the discretion of the city council the submission of final plans and plats and the development of the planned unit development in phases and include such conditions as the city council may deem appropriate 5 no building permit or occupancy certificate shall be issued until the recording of the final plan and plat for the proposed planned unit development or the phase thereof in which the property to which such permit or certificate relates is located c final plan and plat stage 1 within one 1 year after the adoption of the ordinance approving the preliminary plan and plat and granting a special use permit for the planned unit development the owner or his agent shall file with the administrator an application final development plan and subdivision plat if necessary containing in final form all the information required in the preliminary plan and approval ordinance along with all such other documents as may be necessary to implement the plan or to comply with all applicable requirements of this upon receipt the administrator shall refer said plan and plat to the zoning board of appeals the administrator may also refer said plan and plat to any other staff as he deems necessary in order to provide review and comment to the zoning board of appeals notwithstanding any provision contained herein to the contrary when the city council has approved the phasing of any planned unit development the final plan and plat for each phase shall be filed within the time frames established by the city council 2 within thirty 30 days after receipt of all documentation if the final plan and plat are in the opinion of the zoning board of appeals deemed to be sufficient in compliance with all applicable city ordinances and in substantial conformity with the approved preliminary plan and plat they shall be approved by the zoning board of appeals and recommended to the city council copies of the final plan and plat along with a recommendation shall be transmitted to the city council 3 within thirty 30 days after receipt of the zoning board of appeals recommendation and in no event later than sixty 60 days after the filing of the final plan and plat or the last required document or other paper whichever is later and provided all requirements set forth in subsection 156c of this article have been met the city council shall receive said recommendation and approve said final plan and plat approve said plan and plat with modifications or deny said final plan and plat d conditions and guarantees as a condition to the approval of any planned unit development the zoning board of appeals may recommend and the city council may stipulate such conditions and restrictions upon the establishment location design layout height density construction maintenance aesthetics operation and other elements of the planned unit development as deemed necessary for the protection of the public interest improvement of the development and protection of the adjacent area in all cases in which planned unit developments are granted the city council shall require such evidence and guarantees as it may deem necessary as proof that the conditions stipulated in connection therewith are being and will be complied with o012  1exh b 12172001  o0021  1 6172002 154  changes and modifications of the planned unit development a changes in the final plan and plat before approval if the final plan and plat are not in substantial conformity with the approved preliminary plan and plat the zoning board of appeals shall not approve said final plan and plat but instead shall require a new application the city council may however approve variations from any phasing schedule contained within the ordinance granting the special use permit without a new application b after the approval of the final plan the use of land and the construction modification or alteration of any buildings or structures within the planned unit development will be governed by the approved final plan c no changes may be made in the approved final plan except upon application to the appropriate body according to the following procedure 1 minor changes in the location siting and height of buildings and structures and in the location of streets and ways of public access and in the size and location of open space may be authorized by the administrator as required by engineering or other circumstances not foreseen at the time that the final plan was approved if they are consistent with the purpose and intent of the final plan 2 all changes in land uses any rearrangement of lots blocks and building tracts minimum setbacks any major changes in the provision of open space and all other changes in approved final plans must be made by the city council under the procedures authorized by the zoning ordinance for a special use permit including adequate notice and a public hearing before the zoning board of appeals o012  1exh b 12172001 155  revocation of a special use permit for a planned unit development a revocation of a special use permit planned unit developments are permitted based upon conditions and considerations existing at the time zoning relief any rezoning together with the grant of a special use permit is granted approving the planned unit development planned unit developments shall be constructed and completed in a timely manner any special use permit authorizing a planned unit development shall be automatically revoked under the following conditions 1 the developer fails to follow the schedule in the planned unit development must be of a type and so located as to avoid adverse impact upon surrounding properties d need a clear showing of need for why a planned unit development is appropriate district including any provision for increased width or depth for transition yards between different zoning districts preliminary engineering plans shall be approved prior to zoning board of appeals consideration of a preliminary planned unit development proposal f final engineering plans shall be approved prior to zoning board of appeals consideration of a final planned unit development proposal g access adequate provision shall be made to provide ingress and egress so designed as to minimize the traffic congestion in the public streets h any planned unit development with common open space shall have a property owners association o012  1exh b 12172001  o0079  17 18 3162009   residential standards a residential planned unit developments shall only be permitted in the r3 and r6 zoning districts b lot size the minimum size for a residential planned unit development shall be ten 10 acres c density planned unit developments or the portions thereof devoted to residential uses shall be limited to a maximum number of dwelling units equal to the result of the net residential area divided by the minimum lot area provided under the requirements of the applicable underlying zoning district the net residential area shall be determined by subtracting twenty 20 percent from the gross area of the planned unit development for streets and other required improvements regardless of the amount of land actually devoted to same the area of land devoted to common open space public use andor recreational use shall be included in the net residential area individual lots may be less than permitted by the underlying district provided that additional open space is provided in excess of any land provided to comply with the landcash provisions of the subdivision regulations in no event shall a lot for a single family home be less than eight thousand 8000 square feet d setbacks in addition to the minimum perimeter setbacks there shall be an additional ten 10 foot setback along arterial or collector streets e unit size twofamily and multifamily developments shall comply with the minimum dwelling unit size set forth in the r6 residential district standards set forth in this ordinance o012  1exh b 12172001   nonresidential standards a nonresidential planned unit developments shall only be permitted in the b2 b3 m and ori zoning districts b lot size the minimum size for a nonresidential planned unit development shall be five 5 acres c parking a variance from the parking regulations may be permitted if supported by a parking study by an independent consultant justifying any reduction in required parking d shared parking shared parking may be permitted if supported by a parking study by an independent consultant justifying an arrangement shared parking could allow two or more uses to share the same minimum number of parking stalls provided that the uses would not use the parking spaces to be shared at the same time in allowing any reduction the city may require landbanking of additional parking spaces e parking lot landscaping parking lots shall be landscaped no less than the minimum standards set forth in other sections of this ordinance f landscape setbacks landscape setbacks shall be maintained in accordance with the minimum landscape setbacks set forth within the underlying district as set forth in this ordinance g signage signs for a development shall be minimized to provide the planned unit development with an overall identity that does not lead to a proliferation of signage that may cause confusion or safety concerns signage shall include a complimentary design throughout the planned unit development h architectural style developments shall include complimentary architectural styles and materials to ensure a cohesive development o012  1exh b 12172001  o0040  26 6162003 158  findings the zoning board of appeals shall after the public hearing set forth to the city council the reason for the recommendation and said proposed plan is consistent with the comprehensive plan and the stated purpose and intent of the planned unit development regulations b the extent to which the proposed plan meets the requirements and standards of the planned unit development regulations c the extent to which the proposed plan departs from the zoning and subdivision regulations otherwise applicable to the subject property including but not limited to the density dimension area bulk and use and the reasons why such departures are deemed to be in the public interest d the method by which the proposed plan makes adequate provision appendix b  subdivision regulations footnotes  1  editors note  adopted  amended app b to read as herein set out prior to amendment app b pertained to similar subject matter consisted of  ixxi and was consultants etc  211  fire limits  41  housing code  716 et seq  water and sewer services  181 et seq title this ordinance shall hereafter be known cited and referred to as the land subdivision regulations of the city of west chicago and is adopted pursuant to the authorization of of the illinois revised statutes purpose the subdivision of land is the first step in the process of urban development the arrangement of land parcels in the community for residential commercial and industrial uses and for streets alleys schools parks and other public purposes will determine to a large degree the conditions of health safety economy and amenity that prevail in the urban area piecemeal planning of land subdivisions without correlation to the city of west chicagos comprehensive plan could bring about a disastrous disconnected patchwork of plats resulting in poor circulation of traffic and unattractive neighborhoods and communities therefore these regulations and standards for the subdivision and improvement of land for urban use to make provision for adequate light air open space drainage transportation public utilities and other needs to ensure the development and maintenance of a healthy attractive and efficient community that provides for the conservation and protection of its human and natural resources these regulations are designed intended and should be administered in a manner a to implement the general development plan  b to promote the public health safety and general welfare  c to harmoniously relate the development of various tracts of land to the existing community and facilitate the future development of adjoining tracts  d to avoid undue concentration of population and overcrowding of land  e to lessen congestion in the streets and highways  f to provide for adequate light and air  g to facilitate adequate provision for transportation water sewage schools parks playground and other public requirements and to reconcile any differences of interest  h to provide for proper ingress and egress  and i to ensure proper legal description and proper monumenting of subdivided land  to establish and maintain adequate and accurate records of all land subdivision these regulations are established with reasonable consideration for the character of the city with a view toward conserving the value of buildings upon the land and providing the best possible environment for human habitation it is intended that these regulations shall supplement and facilitate the enforcement of the provisions and development standards contained in the building codes official map regulations zoning ordinance housing code and the comprehensive plan of the city of west chicago jurisdiction the city of west chicago land subdivision regulations shall apply to all subdivisions of land as defined herein located within the city of west chicago and within one and onehalf 1 miles of the corporate limits of the city in accordance with authority vested in the municipality under the provisions of of the illinois revised statutes as amended rules and definitions for the purpose of these regulations certain terms and phrases used herein are defined as follows 41 rules in the construction of this ordinance the rules and definitions contained in this section shall be observed and applied except when the context clearly indicates otherwise a words used in the present tense shall include the future the words used in the singular number shall include the plural number and the plural the singular b the word shall is mandatory and not discretionary c the word may is permissive d the masculine gender includes the feminine and neuter e whenever a word or term defined hereinafter appears in the text of this ordinance its meaning shall be construed as set forth in the definition thereof and any word appearing in parentheses directly after a word herein defined shall be construed in the same sense as that word  and f the following words and terms wherever they occur in this ordinance shall be construed as herein defined 42 definitions administrative officer is the city administrator or city official designated by the mayor and city council of west chicago as the officer responsible for administering and enforcing all of the requirements and provisions of the city of west chicago land subdivision regulations alley is a public rightofway designed to serve as secondary access to the side or rear of those properties whose principal frontage is on a street block is a tract of land bounded by streets or by a combination of streets and public parks cemeteries railroad rightsofway shorelines of waterways or boundary lines of the city of west chicago building is any structure built for the support shelter or enclosure of persons animals chattels or moveable property of any kind and which is permanently affixed to the land building setback line is a line within a lot or other parcel of land so designated on the preliminary plan between said line and the adjacent street the erection of an enclosed structure or a fence or hedge over three 3 feet in height is prohibited city council is the mayor and aldermen of the city of west chicago city staff is any combination of employees or consultants of the city deemed necessary by the administrative officer for enforcement of the provisions of this ordinance comprehensive plan is the general development plan reviewed and recommended by the plan commission and adopted by the city council and all subsequent amendments and supplements thereto indicating the general locations recommended for the principal streets parks public buildings zoning district character and extent of community development and other physical aspects of urban planning on file in the office of the city clerk of the city of west chicago illinois and in the office of the recorder of deeds of dupage county or kane county as applicable contour map is a map on which irregularities of the land surface are shown by lines connecting points of equal elevations contour intervals is the vertical height between contour lines culdesac is a local street with only one outlet and having an appropriate terminal for the safe and convenient reversal of traffic movement easement is a grant by a property owner of the use of land for a specific purpose final plat is the map or plan of record of a subdivision and accompanying material as described in frontage is the length of the front property line of the lot lots or tract of land abutting a public street grade is the slope of a road street or other public way specified in percent % grade landing is the grade required on streets entering major thoroughfares at points of intersection as specified herein improvement public is any sanitary sewer storm sewer drainage ditch water main roadway parkway sidewalk pedestrianway planting strip offstreet parking area or other facility for which the city of west chicago may ultimately assume the responsibility for maintenance and operation limited access expressway or highway is a trafficway including toll roads for in respect to which owners or occupants of abutting property or lands and other persons have no legal right of access to or from the same except at such points and in such manner as may be determined by the public authority having jurisdiction over such trafficway lot is a parcel of land located within a single block occupied by or intended for occupancy by one principal building or principal use and having its principal frontage on a street lot corner is a lot situated at the junction of and abutting on two 2 or more intersecting streets  or a lot at the point of deflection in alignment of a single street the interior angle of which does not exceed one hundred thirtyfive 135 degrees lot flag reserve is a lot where access is obtained by way of a narrow strip of land the reserve from a dedicated rightofway lot line is a boundary line of any lot except that where any portion of the lot extends into the abutting street or alley such portion of the lot line thereof shall be deemed to be the street or alley line lot a lot which has a pair of opposite lot lines along two 2 substantially parallel streets and which is not a corner lot on a both street lines shall be deemed front lot lines but in the case of two 2 or more contiguous there shall be a common front lot line lot width is the horizontal distance between the side lot lines of a lot measured at the front building setback line metes and bounds is a method of property description whereby properties are described by means of their direction and distances from an easily identifiable location or point outlot is a parcel of land within a subdivision and which has been included on a preliminary or final plat but not designated as a buildable lot due to insufficient size andor frontage or peculiar siting or topographical problems owner is any person group of persons firm or firms corporate or corporations or any other legal entity having legal title to the land sought to be subdivided under this ordinance pedestrianway or crosswalk is a rightofway across or within a block for use by pedestrian traffic whether designated as a pedestrianway crosswalk or however otherwise designated and may include utilities where necessary person is any individual firm association partnership corporations trust or any other legal entity planned development shall mean a parcel of land or contiguous parcels of land  of a size sufficient to create its own environment  controlled by a single landowner or by a group of landowners in common agreement as to control  to be developed as a single entity the enforcement of which is compatible with adjacent parcels and the intent of the zoning district or districts in which such land area is located the developer or developers may be granted relief from specific land use regulations and design standards and may be awarded certain premiums in return for assurance of an overall quality of development including any specific features which will be of exceptional benefit to the community as a whole and which would not otherwise be allowed by the zoning ordinance plan commission is that body authorized to consider matters relative to planning zoning and subdivision platting and make recommendations to the city council of west chicago illinois preapplication is a preliminary consultation between the developer and city staff in order to discuss the developers intent to subdivide land the preapplication procedure is designed to provide direction for the developer and to eliminate needless costs preliminary plat is a map showing the salient features of a proposed subdivision submitted to the plan commission for purposes of preliminary consideration rightofway is a strip of land occupied or intended to be occupied by a street crosswalk railroad line electric transmission line oil or gas pipeline water main sanitary or storm sewer main or for another special use the usage of the term rightofway for land platting purposes in west chicago shall mean that every rightofway hereafter established and shown on a final plat is to be separate and distinct from the lots or parcels adjoining such rightofway and not included within the dimensions of areas of such lots or parcels rightsofway intended for streets crosswalks watermains sanitary sewers storm drains or any other use involving maintenance by a public agency shall be dedicated to public use by the maker of the plat on which such rightofway is established roadway is a paved portion of a street available for vehicular traffic sewerage disposal system individual is a septic tank seepage tile sewage disposal system or any other sewage treatment device approved by the city engineer as being in accordance with the rules of the state department of public health andor dupage county health regulations and servicing only one lot sidewalk is that portion of a street or crosswalk way rightofway paved intended for pedestrian use only street is a public or private rightofway which affords a primary means of vehicular access to abutting properties whether designated as a street avenue highway road boulevard lane throughway or however otherwise designated but excepting driveways to buildings street collector is a street which carries traffic from minor streets to the system of major streets and highways including the principal entrance streets of a residential development and the principal circulating streets within a development street major is a street designated as such in the comprehensive plan or official map for the city of west chicago or by action of the city council which is intended to serve a relatively large volume of traffic not originating or terminating in the particular neighborhood street frontage is a minor street which is parallel and adjacent to a major street or highway and which provides access to abutting properties and protection from street minor is a street of limited continuity used primarily for access to abutting properties and serving local needs of a neighborhood subdivider is any person or corporation or duly authorized agent who undertakes the subdivision of land as defined herein subdivision is the partitioning or dividing of a parcel or tract of land where the act of division creates a subdivision not exempt under the provisions of 765 illinois compiled statutes except that the exemption provided by 765 illinois compiled statutes 2051b9 shall not be applicable with respect to property subject to the jurisdiction of the city in addition as used herein a subdivision shall be deemed to include a planned unit development subdivision minor lot split is any subdivision of a parcel of land  along an existing public street  not involving the opening widening extension of any street or road  nor are any public improvements required  and involving no more than ten 10 lots subdivision design standards are the basic land planning standards established as guides for the preparation of preliminary plats thoroughfare is a street with a high degree of continuity including collectors major arterials and limited access highways water supply individual is a well and appurtenances supplying only one lot and subject to the approval of the city engineer as being in accordance with the rules interpretation 511 regarding interpretation and application the provisions of this ordinance shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety and general welfare 512 where the conditions imposed by any provisions of this ordinance upon the subdivision of land are either more restrictive or less restrictive than comparable conditions imposed by any other city ordinance or any other applicable law the city ordinance or other applicable law which is more restrictive and imposes a higher standard or requirement shall govern 513 this ordinance is not intended to abrogate any easement covenant or any other private agreement provided that where the regulations of this ordinance are more restrictive or impose higher standard or regulations than such easement covenant or other private agreement the requirements of this ordinance shall govern 514 any subdivision of land which was not lawfully existing at the time of the adoption of this ordinance shall not be made lawful solely by reason of the adoption of this ordinance and to the extent that said subdivision of land is in conflict in any manner with the requirements of this ordinance said subdivision of land remains unlawful hereunder administration and enforcement 61 administrative officer the community development director shall be the administrative officer of this ordinance and it shall be his duty to administer and enforce the provisions hereof 62 plan review and inspections the city engineer or his duly designated representative shall review all plans and specifications and shall inspect all improvements proposed to be made under this ordinance during the court course of construction 63 transfers of lots building permits and occupancy permits a no person shall sell convey or transfer any lot in a subdivision until the final plat of subdivision has been approved by the city council in accordance with this ordinance and recorded with the county recorder of deeds b no building permit shall be issued providing for the improvement of any lot in a subdivision until the final plat of subdivision and the plans and specifications for the public improvements have been approved by the city council and the final plat of subdivision has been recorded with the county recorder of deeds c no occupancy permit shall be issued for any structure within any subdivision until all required utility facilities have been installed and made ready to serve the subdivision and access to the property has been constructed provided however that occupancy permits may be issued prior to the installation of the final lift of pavement on the street or streets serving the subdivision 64 deviation the city council may authorize a deviation from these regulations after review and recommendation by the plan commission when in its opinion undue hardship may result from strict compliance and provided the deviation applies only to the requirements of this ordinance the city council may take such action only upon receipt from the plan commission of a written recommendation specifying the manner in which the findings required in this section have or have not been met by the facts pertinent to the requested deviation except in the case of planned unit developments approved pursuant to the citys zoning ordinance no deviation shall be granted by the city council except in the following circumstances a that there are special circumstances or conditions affecting said property such that the strict application of the provisions of this ordinance would deprive the applicant of the reasonable use of his land b that the deviation is necessary for the preservation and enjoyment of a substantial property right of the applicant c that the granting of the deviation will not be detrimental to the public welfare or injurious to other property in the area in which said property is located d that the alleged hardship has not been created by any person having a present proprietary interest in the property 65  fee  a fee shall accompany each application for any approval or relief pursuant to this ordinance such fee shall be paid to the city at construction failure on the part of the public agency to initiate acquisition via condemnation proceedings within twelve 12 months shall result in the removal of the reserved designation from the property involved and the freeing of the property for immediate development 85 vacation of a plat of subdivision any plat or any part of a plat may be vacated by the owner of the premises at any time before the sale of any lot therein by a written instrument to which a copy of such plat shall be attached declaring the same to be vacated such an instrument shall be approved by the city council in like manner as plats of subdivisions the city council may reject any such instrument which abridges or destroys any public rights in any of its streets or alleys such an instrument shall be executed acknowledged or approved and recorded or filed in the like manner as plats of subdivisions  and being duly recorded or filed shall operate to destroy the force and effect of the recording of the plat so vacated and to divest all public rights in the streets alleys and public grounds and all dedications laid out or described in such plat when lots have been sold the plat may be vacated in the manner herein provided by all the owners of lots in such plat joining in the execution of such writing 86 subdivisions created by successive divisions whenever a parcel of land is subdivided into lots the city of west chicago water system a subdivision outside corporate limits may be supplied with water from individual wells located on each lot provided that such water supplies are approved by the county health department having jurisdiction over such subdivision b the water distribution system shall be constructed throughout the subdivision in such a manner as to provide each lot with a separate connection water mains shall not be less than eight 8 inches in diameter shall extend to the extremities of streets alleys or easements which are served by water mains and shall in each case be looped  that is arranged to avoid dead ends the system shall be designed and constructed in conformance with the all applicable rules and regulations of the illinois environmental protection agency shutoff valves shall be provided at each branch at each main connection at intervals not exceeding six hundred 600 feet on all mains except principal feeders at intervals not exceeding one thousand five hundred 1500 feet on all principal feeders and elsewhere as required to permit adequate sectionization for maintenance purposes fire hydrants shall be installed throughout the entire system at intervals not exceeding three hundred 300 feet a house service connection shall be provided at the center of each lot extending to the property line before roadway pavement is constructed materials systems arrangements and details of design shall be subject to the approval of the city council of west chicago upon recommendation of city engineer 932  sewer systems  a all subdivisions within the sewage disposal facilities on individual lots provided that such sewage disposal facilities are approved by the county health department having jurisdiction over such subdivision b sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities shall meet the requirements of the illinois environmental protection agency sanitary and storm sewers shall not be combined sewer mains with house stubs shall be installed prior to the construction of the pavement service stubs shall be run to the center of each lot and shall extend to the property line the sewer main shall be extended to the end of the street alley or easement it is serving sanitary sewer mains shall be a minimum of eight 8 inches in diameter service stubs for new construction shall be a minimum of six 6 inches in diameter for maintenance and a storm of a tenyear frequency as defined in the illinois state water survey bulletin 70 storm sewers shall be designed to carry the tenyear frequency design flow at a minimum velocity of three 3 feet arrangement a all streets shall be properly integrated with the existing and proposed system of thoroughfares and dedicated rightsofway as established in the comprehensive plan b all thoroughfares shall be properly related to special traffic generators such as industries business districts schools churches and shopping centers  to population densities  and to the pattern of existing and proposed land uses c minor streets shall be laid out to conform as much as possible to the topography to discourage use by to permit efficient drainage and utility systems and to require the minimum number of streets necessary to provide convenient safe access to property d the rigid rectangular gridiron street pattern need not necessarily be adhered to and the use of curvilinear streets prevented by topography or other physical conditions or unless in the opinion of the plan commission such extension is not necessary or desirable for the coordination of the layout of the subdivision in complete conformity with the comprehensive plan 2 does the subdivision make adequate provisions for storm and floodwater runoff channels or basins 3 the subdivision gives consideration to the preservation of natural features such as large trees and watercourses and to historical and similar features 4 is the parcel to be subdivided suitable for residential use 5 streets generally a streets are located in relation to topographical conditions and natural terrain features ie streams and existing tree growth etc b streets are properly integrated with the existing and proposed system of thoroughfares as established on the comprehensive plan c thoroughfares are properly related to special traffic generators ie industries business districts schools churches etc d minor and local streets are laid out to conform to topography and to discourage use by e proposed streets are extended to the boundary lines of the subdivision 6 subdivisions adjacent to railroad rightsofway or limited access freeways a in residential districts a buffer strip 25 feet wide is added to the normal depth of each lot b in commercial or industrial districts lots are of sufficient depth for uses to back on railroad or highway c streets parallel to a railroad intersecting street crossing the railroad are at least 150 feet distant from railroad 7 access to major arterials when a subdivision borders on or contains an arterial streets access is limited in one of the following ways a subdivision lots back onto major street fronting on a parallel street with screen planting between the lot and the arterial b a series of culsdesac ushaped or loop streets entered from and designed generally at right angles to a parallel street with the rear lines of their terminal lots backing onto the arterial street c a marginal access or service road is provided separated from the arterial by a planting strip d total number of residential or local streets entering arterial is kept to a minimum 8 street design standards all streets meet the minimum design standards a local streets 1 rightofway 40 50 60 feet  2 pavement 24 26 32 feet  b collector streets 1 rightofway 60 60 70 feet  2 pavement 30 32 40 feet  c street grades for major streets do not exceed 6 percent 9 other street requirements a culsdesac serving less than 25 dwelling units to not exceed 1000 feet in length b culsdesac serving 25 or more dwelling units do not exceed 500 feet in length c no half  streets are provided 10 street intersections all street intersections meet the following criteria a streets intersect at right angles not less than 75 degrees b center line offsets jogs of streets are at least 150 feet c curb radii as follows are provided 1 intersection two local streets 20 feet 2 intersection involving collector street at least 30 feet d intersections are designed with a flat grade e cross slopes of all streets including intersections are 3 percent or less 11 alleys a alleys are provided in all commercial and industrial areas b all alleys are 24 feet in width or greater c no deadend alleys are included without adequate turnaround facilities d no alleys are provided in residential areas 12 block standards a all blocks have two 2 tiers of lots except blocks adjacent to railroad rightsofway etc b block lengths 1 blocks do not exceed 2000 feet in length 2 blocks are at least 500 feet long 3 blocks along major arterial and collector streets are not less than 1000 feet c pedestrianways 10 feet wide are provided blocks exceeding 800 feet in length where essential 13 lot standards a lot sizes conform to the zoning ordinance resolution b depth and width of properties reserved for commercialindustrial uses are sufficient to provide for offstreet parking and loading c on arterial streets or commercialindustrial lots provide at least 25 feet additional depth d every lot notwithstanding planned developments has principal access on a public street e drainage flows away from the lot to an approved drainage system f generally lots are not platted at right angles to each other g side lot lines are at approximately right angles to street lines h corner lots have extra width to purposes per 1280 acres of territory the required land dedication shall be determined for nonresidential developments or nonresidential portions of developments by multiplying the total building hardship to a particular developer 9 dedicated sites topography grading and improvements the slope topography and geology of each dedicated site as well as its surroundings must be suitable for its intended purposes grading on dedicated sites shall not differ greatly from surrounding land notwithstanding the foregoing a dedicated site may with the consent of the public body which would be the recipient of such site include areas of minimal or limited suitability such as wetlands and stormwater detention areas the acreage of such areas of minimal or limited suitability shall not be used to satisfy or be credited against the land dedication requirement with respect to such public body except to the extent that the standards adopted by such public body provide a formula or methodology for crediting or partial crediting of such areas of minimal or limited suitability all sites shall be dedicated as improved sites ie in a graded seeded andor sodded condition with appropriate drainage and erosion controls and ready for full service of streets including but not limited to pavement curbs gutters and street lights sewers water and electrical and other utilities or acceptable provision made therefore sidewalks and trees shall be included within the definition of improved sites but may be delayed for school and fire protection sites due to the delay time between dedication of any such sites and construction of facilities thereon 10 title of sites all sites shall be conveyed to the city either by warranty or trustees deed provided however that the city may permit such conveyance directly to the public body which would be the recipient of such site the subdivider or developer shall be responsible for conveying good merchantable title to such sites and shall be responsible for payment of all real estate taxes to the date of conveyance including any agricultural roll back taxes which might be extended or levied against such sites for any tax years or periods prior to the time of conveyance 11 sale of dedicated land when in the opinion of the unit of local government holding title to any parcel of land dedicated hereunder any such parcel has become unnecessary or unsuitable or inconvenient such parcel may be sold as provided by applicable statutory authority and the proceeds shall be held in trust by said unit of local government solely for such uses as are provided for herein and said proceeds shall be subject to the ten 10 year expenditure requirements from and after the date when said land is converted to cash proceeds 12 property conveyance any property transferred to the city of west chicago hereunder shall be transferred so as to be unencumbered by any liens taxes or other clouds upon title of said property the grantor of derivation of app c cross reference civil service rules and regulations app d article i  general provisions a  authority and administration the city administrator shall administer or cause to be administered the provisions of this manual this authority includes the following activities 1 hire and promote within budgeted authority  2 establish and approve appropriate work rules consistent with the terms of this manual  3 discipline demote suspend lay off and recommend dismissal of any employee  4 determine when work performed by employees may be more effectively or efficiently contracted  and 5 interpret the meaning of these rules the department heads will be expected to work with the administration department concerning any personnel matter in their departments  62199   3192001 b  amendments and revisions this manual will be issued to all employees new fulltime employees will receive the manual during their employee orientation the city of west chicago like so many other employers must be dynamic and changes may occur amendments to these rules will be made from time to time by ordinance prepared by the city administrator and approved by the city council all amendments shall be acknowledged by employees signing of an amendment acknowledgement form as you receive changes either make a note of them in the manual or place a copy in the manual for future reference amendments will normally be posted prior to their effective date the city however reserves the right to make changes without notice when it is deemed appropriate amendments may have a retroactive effect to reflect a practice adopted prior to a formal revision of the rules in any event if you have questions either speak to your supervisor or contact the administration department theyll be happy to speak to you city employees are encouraged to submit comments or suggestions to the administration department  62199   3192001 c  external agreements and laws in the event of a conflict between the terms of this manual and those of an applicable collective bargaining agreement the collective bargaining agreement shall control if any of the policies adopted herein conflict with state or federal laws or the rules and regulations of the civil service commission those laws and rules shall take precedence some employees may have an employment agreement or contract with the city  in the event of a conflict that employment agreement shall take precedence  62199   3192001 d  gender clause whenever the male gender is used in this manual he him his the term shall be interpreted to mean and apply to both males and females equally  62199   3192001 e  application unless otherwise provided the personnel rules shall apply to all officers and employees of the city of west chicago except elected officials board and commission members and the city attorney rules and regulations specifically applicable to employees not covered by the civil service commission are noted throughout the manual if conflicts arise between the provisions of this manual and either collective bargaining agreements or employment contracts the latter shall prevail  62199   3192001  o0001  2 262006 f  civil service commission additional personnel policies pertaining to sworn personnel in the police department covered under civil service jurisdiction in those positions deemed classified under the civil service act will be found under the civil service rules and regulations published by the civil service commission and are located in appendix d of the city  62199   3192001  o0001  3 262006 g  chain of command the city recognizes everyones right to freedom of expression in matters of public concern matters that are merely personal to the employee should be addressed hierarchy of command starting with the immediate supervisor the management and administration of the city has the responsibility to address issues or decisions that may affect personal aspects of employment and in many cases they can be resolved the city maintains a grievance procedure to resolve issues between employees and the city regarding the inappropriate or misapplication of policy contained in the personnel manual violating this provision of the manual may lead to disciplinary action  62199   3192001 h  requests for city personnel department heads shall inform the city administrator of vacancies in their departments if the city administrator approves the request for a nonappointed employee he shall forward such request to the chief examiner for the civil service commission to establish an eligible list that will be used to fill the vacancy  62199   3192001 i  employment categories the city classifies positions in three categories full time parttime and temporaryseasonal 1 fulltime regular employees scheduled to work a minimum workweek of forty 40 hours fulltime employees who have successfully completed their probationary period are eligible for the complete benefit program of the city 2 time regular employees scheduled to work less than forty 40 hours a week with no set duration of employment time employees who have successfully completed their probationary period are only eligible for vacation time as mentioned later in the manual and legally required mandated benefits including deductions for the illinois municipal retirement fund imrf they are also eligible for certain payroll deductions such as deferred compensation plans direct deposit medicaldental and dependant care at their own cost etc 3 seasonal or temporary employees hired for a specific period of time or for the duration of a specific project or group of assignments of limited duration not to exceed ninety 90 days in a twelve 12 month period this category of employees is eligible only for legally mandated benefits  62199   3192001 j  definitions appointed or exempt position a position that is filled by the mayor with the consent of the city council employment may be governed by a contract signed with the city city as used in this manual city means the city of west chicago city council as used in this manual city council refers to the city council of the city of west chicago city administrator the city administrator is the chief administrative officer of the city who is appointed by the mayor with the consent of the city council classified position or protective service a position that has been appointed by the city administrator from the civil service commissions eligibility list who has successfully completed his probationary period collective bargaining agreement as used in these rules this term will refer to any effective and applicable labor agreement between the city of west chicago and unions representing employees continuous service as used in this manual this term describes the method by which work time is calculated for the purpose of determining vacation and sick leave benefit accumulation only except as otherwise provided by this manual a unit of continuous service is earned if the employee works at least fifty 50 percent of the days he or she is scheduled in the period appropriate to that unit continuous service for all benefits and leave will be calculated from the date of the most recent employment past employment will not be calculated and applied toward earnings dischargetermination discharge is the permanent removal from employment with the corresponding permanent loss of all privileges of employment grievance the timely expression of dissatisfaction by an employee regarding the application of any of the terms and conditions of employment described in this manual including but not limited to the application of disciplinary procedures by a supervisor rates of pay hours of work or application of standard of workload immediate family this term refers to an employees child spouse or parent parent means the person who acted as the employees parent when the employee was a child except as otherwise noted this term does not include a parentinlaw job evaluation and classification a technique for analyzing work in which the activities and requirements of a job are described according to a standardized procedure individual jobs are then classified with those sufficiently similar jobs are evaluated on a point based system points are based on the factors of expertise decision making supervisory responsibilities contact with others required by the job and working conditions performance evaluation this is an objective evaluation of the employees performance an opportunity is provided for the employee to discuss such items as expectations personal performance and methods of improvement with a supervisor regular schedule not less than eighty 80 hours per pay period regular workday a workday is defined as an eight and onehalf 8 hour day which includes a thirty 30 minute unpaid lunch reprimandoral oral reprimands consist of a conference between the employees supervisor or department head issuing the reprimand and the employee for the purpose of expressing disapproval of misconduct or poor work performance clarifying applicable rules or standards of performance policies and procedures and warning that repetition of the misconduct or failure to improve work performance may result in more severe discipline reprimandwritten written reprimands consist of a conference between the employees supervisor or department head issuing the reprimand and the employee  and of a letter or memorandum expressing disapproval of misconduct or poor work performance clarifying applicable rules or standards of performance policies and procedures and warning that repetition of the misconduct or failure to improve work performance may result in more severe discipline suspension a suspension is a temporary removal from employment which may or may not be accompanied by a concurrent temporary loss of privileges of employment including but not limited to salary and benefits time worked a day will be considered worked if the employee is present for their full regular schedule or on a paid holiday paid vacation or paid leave  62199   3192001 k  appointment of temporary acting city administrator in the event that the city administrator shall be absent from the city or ceases to perform the duties or hold the office of city administrator the mayor may appoint a temporary acting city administrator to perform the duties of said office until the city administrator returns to the city of a new city administrator is appointed to and qualifies for office  3192001 article ii  terms of employment a  general provisions the city administrator is appointed by the mayor with the consent of the city council with the exception of those specific positions listed in of the city whose appointments adhere to the same rules hiring for all other positions falls within the authority of the city administrator or the civil service commission as appropriate all recruitment and selection processes shall adhere to federal state and local employment laws  62199   3192001  o0001  5 262006 b  equal employment opportunity the city of west chicago its officials agents and employees are legally required to practice policies that are in compliance with federal equal employment opportunity laws and executive orders forbidding any type of discrimination against the employees or applicants it is the citys policy to offer equal employment opportunity to all persons without regard to race color creed religion sex age national origin or ancestry marital status military status except dishonorable discharge or qualifying disability or other legally protected category any individuals legally protected status shall not be a factor in any phase of employment including hiring payment of wages job assignment seniority promotion transfer layoff discipline discharge or any other term or condition of employment no one will be retaliated against by the city for exercising his rights under this policy  62199   3192001 c  employment application in general applications for employment shall be submitted to the administration department on a prescribed employment application form the application form shall be completed in its entirety and any evidence of falsification or fraud on the form may be grounds for discharge or disqualification from consideration for employment  62199   3192001 d  background investigation a background investigation may be completed on every new employee prior to employment applicants must possess or qualify to possess a valid drivers license of the appropriate class depending on the nature of their position or assignment drivers license status along with driving history must be verified with the secretary of states office  62199   3192001 e  postoffer examination physical and drugalcohol screen applicants for a full or parttime position who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to take a postoffer medical examination andor drugalcohol screen by a licensed physician designated and paid for by the city individuals who with reasonable accommodation are capable of performing the essential functions of the job will be considered for employment  62199   3192001 f  citizenship and residence all employees of the city hired after  must be citizens of the united states or be an alien authorized to work in the united states under the provisions of the federal immigration reform and control act all new employees will be required to submit documentation to the city which establishes both the employees identity and eligibility to work in the united states as required by law although city employees are encouraged to reside in west chicago residency within the city or at any specific distance from the city is not a prerequisite for initial or continued employment unless specifically required in a job description or contract  62199   3192001 g  new employee orientation and training it is important for an employee to understand the benefits and conditions of employment from the very outset an orientation will be conducted by the administration department on an individual or group basis on or before you begin work on the first day during orientation you will be given enrollment information for the citys benefit plans required legal documentation will be completed and you will have the opportunity to ask questions concerning your employment it is the responsibility of the department to orient and train new employees as to the procedures within the department such orientation will include an introduction to departmental employees and an explanation of the operations of the department in which the new employee will be working  62199   3192001 h  probationary period all persons employed by the city to fill a position must serve a six 6 month probationary period 1 the purpose of the probationary period is to evaluate the employees ability to satisfactorily perform the job and complete the necessary training or education required for the position an employees supervisor will monitor the employees job performance during this period if the probationary employee fails to attain satisfactory job performance the employee may be dismissed by the department head upon recommendation to and approval by the city administrator or his designee and in the case of civil service employees the civil service commission 2 three 3 months after an employees hire transfer or promotion an informal performance evaluation shall be conducted a formal evaluation of performance by an immediate supervisor shall occur five 5 months after an employees hire transfer or promotion this evaluation will be submitted to the city administrator or his designee and will provide a recommendation for dismissal or retention of the newly hired employee 3 upon successful completion of the probationary period the employee is entitled to all city benefits and privileges prescribed in this manual if the position is classified the city administrator or his designee shall notify the civil service commission of a change in an employees status 4 during the probationary period employees are not entitled to use either vacation or personal days however under certain circumstances exceptions may be made with the approval of the department head and city administrator or his designee  62199   9799   3192001 i  performance appraisals performance appraisals are the formal record of the determinations on which merit pay decisions are made these tools are also used to recognize good performance unrelated to pay considerations  document poor performance as a part of the system of correcting such problems  and document progress in correcting performance problems identified in an earlier review or by other means employees should use performance appraisals as an opportunity to discuss employee development and training needs  as a record of past performance  and as an opportunity to objectively discuss with the supervisor expectations personal performance and methods of improvement 1 formal performance evaluation reports shall be prepared biannually on forms approved by the city administrator 2 a supervisor should review the employees personnel file including prior reviews of goals and success in meeting them and any relevant documentation in advance of the meeting the departmental performance evaluation should be completed prior to the meeting 3 whether an employee is entitled to a pay increase or not the supervisor will present a written performance appraisal in november update goals and april merit pay review the employee will be asked to sign this document whether he agrees or disagrees with the contents  the employee may incorporate his own comments in the evaluation the signature on the completed appraisal means that the employee has had an opportunity to review the document and does not necessarily signify agreement with the supervisors opinions 4 completed appraisals will be forwarded to the department head for review and to add written comments and then it is submitted to the administration department for final review the administration department will review each performance evaluation to ensure that there is sufficient supporting evidence of the results of the review the evaluation will be placed in the employees official personnel file and each department should keep a copy as well 5 a performance evaluation expresses the supervisors opinions and judgments concerning job performance throughout the evaluation period because of this the results of the evaluation are not subject to review or appeal grievance procedure or other formal review process if an employee is in disagreement with the appraisal he may discuss the issues with the next level of management within five 5 days of receiving his appraisal and then to the city administrator or his designee within five 5 days of receiving the last response however their decision is final and must be reported to the applicable supervisor and department head in writing 6 at any time a supervisor may elect and is encouraged to make a record of specific performance without completing a full evaluation such reports should be limited to recognition or problem identification  62199   3192001 j  change of employment classification if department operations permit as determined by the department head and city administrator a fulltime employee may upon request work parttime hours instead of fulltime hours in the same position while on parttime employment status the following conditions shall apply 1 the actual length of time on parttime employment status will be determined by the department head and city administrator or his designee regardless of the time permitted parttime employment status will be continuously monitored and may at any time be revoked by the department head and city administrator or his designee 2 the employee will be treated the same as any other parttime employee that is the employee will earn the same benefits as other parttime employees as outlined in this manual 3 the employee will not earn any sick leave or vacation credits while working on a parttime basis but will earn time toward longevity 4 the employee will be permitted to continue participation in the health and dental programs under the guidelines set forth in article vi section o of this manual  62199   3192001 k  transfers 1 employees request employees who wish to transfer back to a former position shall not be guaranteed the position 2 managements request an employee may be laterally transferred within a department or between departments to a position having the same pay grade and required skill level upon request of the department head of the department to which the employee would be transferring and approval of the city administrator or his designee  62199   3192001  o0112  1 1072002 l  time reports each department will provide forms for recording time worked all employees shall be required to record time accurately and submit a time sheet daily  not sign in or start work before their schedule  take a lunch or dinner break if provided for in their regular shift schedule and record it as time not worked  identify absences which are not considered hours worked for pay purposes  and complete only their own time reports and submit on a timely basis supervisors are required to approve each subordinates time report or pay period time sheet  62199   3192001 article iii  position classification plan a  purpose the purpose of the classification plan is to provide a complete and continuous inventory of all positions in the municipal service and accurate descriptions and specifications for each class of employment to allow for the effective and efficient operation of the city the plan standardizes titles each of which is indicative of a definite range of duties and responsibilities and has the same meaning throughout the municipal service  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 b  policy statement 1 on an annual basis in the first quarter of the calendar year the city administrator will prepare a comprehensive classification pay plan and table of organization to achieve consistent equitable and competitive salary ranges and practices to the extent possible 2 pay practices shall be consistent with the goal of pay for performance for each employee classification general pay and pay increases will be based primarily on an employees performance evaluation 3 in developing the classification and pay plans the city administrator will rely on appropriate analytical techniques including the use of salary survey data 4 the job evaluation shall be used to rank jobs and identify benchmark positions for the compensation comparisons described herein 5 if no comparative data is available for a particular position a positions rank when compared to other similar city positions shall be used as a guide to establish the pay range 6 the citys compensation pay plan is a goal these personnel rules or pay plan do not create or constitute a promise or contract and shall not be binding upon the city 7 nothing in these rules guarantees that any employee is entitled to any particular compensation except as may be required by law  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 c  composition of the classification plan the classification pay plan consists of 1 a grouping into classes of positions which are substantially similar in degree of difficulty required responsibility which require the same general qualifications and which can be equitably compensated within the same range of pay under comparable working conditions 2 a title which identifies and describes the position of each written classification 3 written class specifications for each class of position containing a description of the nature of the work and of the responsibility of the positions in the class examples of work which are illustrative of duties of positions assigned to the class requirements of knowledge abilities and skills necessary for performance of the work a statement of experience and training desirable for recruitment or inclusion into the class and in certain cases necessary special qualifications  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 d  preparation of job descriptions a written job description will usually be developed for all personnel positions of the city of west chicago each job description may include the following items and requirements 1 title or position 2 definition or description of position 3 required or assigned supervision 4 examples of primary responsibilities and duties divided into essential and nonessential categories 5 qualifications including required knowledge and ability statements necessary for the position 6 experience and training required for the position 7 other special licenses certifications or requirements for the position all new personnel positions shall have a job description submitted to and approved by the city council  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 e  class titles class titles shall be used in all personnel budget appropriation and financial records wherever possible  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 f  class specifications specifications are to be interpreted in their entirety and in relation to others in the classification plan specifications are deemed to be descriptive and explanatory of the kind of work performed and not necessarily inclusive of all duties performed  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 g  uses of the classification plan the classification plan shall be used 1 in preparing public announcements of examinations for vacancies or openings 2 as a guide in preparing examinations that will measure qualifications needed to adequately perform the duties and responsibilities of the class 3 in determining the lines of promotion according to the civil service rules and regulations 4 for developing training programs 5 in preparing personnel expenditures in departmental budgets 6 in determining salaries or salary ranges for various types of work 7 in providing uniform job terminology which is easy to understand by all city officials employees and the general public  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 h  maintenance of the classification plan the city administrator or his designee shall make necessary amendments to the classification plan in the form of new classes revision of existing classes and the elimination of classes no longer required in the plan revisions of class specifications and reallocations within the classification plan shall be made as follows 1 the city administrator or his designee shall review the duties and responsibilities of each new position as it is created and positions which duties and responsibilities have changed and designate the appropriate pay range using the principles of internal and external parity 2 the city administrator or his designee shall periodically review the classification of positions and upon the basis of these investigations may combine upgrade downgrade eliminate or if necessary establish new classifications 3 an employee who wishes to have the classification of that position reviewed should refer to the steps in the grievance procedure of these rules see employee conduct and disciplinary procedure grievance procedure  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 article iv  compensation plan a  composition of the compensation plan the compensation pay plan shall be administered by the city administrator and shall include the schedules of standard salary ranges consisting of minimum and maximum rates of pay included in the classification plan the objectives of the pay plan are a to provide salary ranges which are reasonably comparable to those paid by other governmental jurisdictions in the immediate area b to maintain internal parity among positions of similar responsibility and skill levels c to provide a plan based on merit d to provide orderly and uniform means of recognizing employees for good performances e to simplify and facilitate payroll administration budgeting and other phases of financial and personnel administration  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 b  development and maintenance of salary ranges 1 salary ranges shall be reflective of position classification and shall be determined with due regard to the following factors a the knowledge skills and abilities required to satisfactorily perform the work b the nature and degree of supervision received c the nature of supervision exercised d any special working conditions related to the work 2 prior to the preparation of each annual budget as well as at other times as determined by the city administrator the city administrator shall make or shall cause to have made such comparative studies as deemed necessary to assess and evaluate the factors affecting the level of salary ranges on the basis of information derived from such studies and other sources the city administrator may make changes in the assignment of salary ranges to classes  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 c  appointment rate 1 the minimum rate of pay for a class shall be paid upon appointment to the class except that appointment rates above the minimum rate may be paid if the department head submits a written request outlining reasons for such action which request is subject to approval by the city administrator 2 justification for approval will be limited to recognition of exceptional qualifications of a candidate or lack of available candidates employee is transferred promoted or demoted the rate of pay for the new position shall be determined as follows 1 if the rate of pay in the former class is less than the minimum rate established for the class in the new position the rate of pay shall be increased at least to the minimum for the class as approved by the city administrator 2 if the rate of pay in the former class is more than the maximum rate established for the new class the pay shall be reduced to the maximum rate or an intermediate increment of the new range as approved by the city administrator 3 if the rate of pay in the former class falls within the new salary range the rate of pay shall remain the same in the case of transfer rate of pay shall be increased in the case of promotion by an amount or percentage established by the city administrator at the discretion of the department head with the approval of the city administrator rate of pay shall remain the same or shall be adjusted to a lower rate of pay in case of demotion 4 if a reclassification of a position results in a revised salary range the employee serving in the position shall have the rate of pay increased if necessary to the minimum for the class 5 if a reclassification of a position results in an employees rate of pay exceeding the maximum rate of pay for the new position the employees rate of pay shall not be reduced raises for employees in this situation shall only be by incentive  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 e  rate of pay rate of pay increases shall be made on the recommendation of the department head and are subject to approval by the city administrator as indicated by performance evaluations reclassification of a position to a lower grade shall not automatically require a reduction in pay rate to anyone earning in excess of the new grade level but it will preclude general increases the city shall approve any annual salary adjustments in the budget process for that particular year  pay ranges shall be automatically increased by this adjustment and shall require no further council action  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 f  incentive pay 1 all employees at the top of their salary range shall be
