city employment shall receive incentive pay accrued but not paid  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 g  overtimecompensatory work the city compensates for overtime in conformity with the expressed provisions of the fair labor standards act as amended generally the city will compensate employees required to work in excess of forty 40 hours at the rate of one and onehalfhours 1 for each hour of authorized overtime worked paid leave holidays personal days and vacation are counted in determining work which is in excess of the regular work period overtime may only be worked upon approval of an employees supervisor  employees will be disciplined for working overtime which their supervisor has not approved unauthorized overtime employees are expected to work overtime hours if required by departmental needs a regular work period is established for each position by department heads in accordance with payroll schedule this work period may be changed by the department head depending on the departments needs overtime will not be paid for scheduled changes in the work period emergency situations are excluded from this prohibition with the department heads approval and at the employees option employees may take compensatory time off in lieu of pay to the rate one and onehalf 1 hours for each hour of authorized overtime employee requests for using compensatory time shall follow department procedures and shall not be unreasonably denied overtime shall be recorded and reported according to the following rules 1 overtime shall be reported in units of onequarter hour 2 an employee shall be given credit for onequarter hour only if he has worked half of that period 3 the city reserves the right to assign overtime based on an employees performance record as determined by their department head  9799   3192001  o0024  1 452004 h  pay review 1 biannual reviews  all regular fulltime and parttime employees are considered for merit pay raises based on performance pensions regardless of whether such benefits are provided by a practice or written policy of employer health care provider the term health care provider means a a doctor of medicine or osteopathy who is authorized to practice medicine or surgery as appropriate by the state in which the doctor practices  or b any other person determined by the secretary of labor to be capable of providing health care services parent the term parent means the biological parent of an employee or an individual who stood in loco parentis to an employee when the employee was a son or daughter reduced leave schedule the term reduced leave schedule means a leave schedule that reduces the usual number of hours per workweek or hours per workday of an employee serious health condition the term serious health condition means an illness injury impairment or physical or mental condition that involves a inpatient care in a hospital hospice or residential medical care facility including any period of incapacity or any subsequent treatment in connection with such inpatient care  or b continuing treatment by a health care provider son or daughter the term son or daughter means a biological adopted or foster child a stepdaughter or son a legal ward or a daughter or son of a person standing in loco parentis who is a under eighteen 18 years of age  or b eighteen 18 years of age or older and incapable of self care because of a mental or physical disability spouse the term spouse means a husband or wife as the case may be 8 application for leave in all cases an employee requesting leave ending dates of the leave 9 notice of leave an employee intending to take family or medical leave if the leave is foreseeable based on an expected birth or placement or because of a planned medical must be given as soon as practicable 10 medical certification of leave within fifteen 15 days of filing an application for leave based on the serious health condition of the employee or the employees 11 benefits coverage during leave during a period of family or medical leave an employee will be retained on the city health plan under the same conditions that applied before leave commenced to continue health coverage the employee must continue to make any contributions that he or she made to the plan before taking leave failure of the employee to pay his or her share of the health insurance premium may result in loss of coverage if the employee fails to return to work after the expiration of the leave the employee will be required to reimburse the city for payment of the employees portion of the health insurance premiums during the family leave unless the reason the employee fails to return is the presence of a serious health condition which prevents the employee from stating that he or she may return to work 14 failure to return from leave the failure of an employee to return to work upon the expiration of a family or medical leave of absence may subject the employee to immediate termination unless an extension is granted in writing an employee who requests an extension of family leave or medical leave due to the continuation recurrence or onset of his own serious health condition or of the serious health condition of the employees spouse daughter or son or parent must submit a request for an extension in writing to the employees immediate supervisor this written request should be made as soon as the employee realizes that he will not be able to return at the expiration of the leave period the city will notify the employee failing to return from leave about cobra and her or his obligations under the program if a leave extension is granted the city will make its best effort to keep an employees job open until her or his return however if the city feels that it is necessary to fill the position to successfully perform its operations it will submit a letter to said employee informing her or him of the decision the employee will then have seven 7 calendar days to inform the city of his desire to return to work if the employee does not feel that he is capable of returning to work the city will take the steps necessary to fill that position and subsequently place the employees name on a rehire list which will make her or him eligible to fill a similar position in the city 15 concurrent running of other leave the leave sustained a workrelated injuryillness workers compensation will pay for all costs associated with such injuryillness as required by law 4 in the event an employee suffers permanent disability from a workrelated injury the employee must file a claim with the illinois industrial commission this claim will be reviewed by the commission in an effort to determine its validity and the citys responsibility for such claim 5 if the employee is injured during the course of employment by a third party a claim may be filed with the illinois industrial commission and the employee may sue the responsible party although the commission will decide the matter without reference to the third party the employee must if successful in the suit against the third party indemnify the city for all expenses and claims it paid up to the extent of its loss or to the employees recovery whichever amount is smaller in the event the city recovers under such circumstances the city must give the employee all monies in excess of the actual loss it sustained in expenses claims and court costs 6 it is to be especially noted that neither the employee nor his survivors have any further recourse insurance premium  62199   3192001 article vii  employee conduct and disciplinary procedure a  disciplinary action the steps listed below will serve to guide disciplinary actions the steps are progressive in nature increasing the penalty each time an employee is disciplined the steps emphasize continual interaction between the employee and the supervisor andor department head and should provide sufficient opportunity for correction of the inappropriate conduct while making the employee aware of the consequences of the violations in general any action or attitude which adversely affects job performance or the reputation of the city may result in disciplinary action this procedure neither precludes a department head from bypassing a step when disciplining an employee nor does it prohibit a department head from dismissing an employee after consultation with the city administrator the nature extent and seriousness of the offense will determine the appropriate disciplinary action in addition to the general work record and disciplinary record of the employee 1 employee counseling when a less formal means of handling a disciplinary incident is warranted the supervisor may consider an employee counseling session this session will take the form of a meeting between the supervisor and employee and is intended to make the employee aware of a situation or trend in performance or conduct which is unacceptable and which could result in further disciplinary action if continued or repeated the supervisor shall make a record of the counseling session 2 counseling and written reprimand when an increasing level of discipline is warranted a written reprimand shall be issued the reprimand should specifically state the nature of the problem and what it takes to correct it with a comment stating that failure to correct the situation will result in more severe discipline copies of the written reprimand which should have a date for review and supervisors note from step one should go the department head and the city administrator or his designee both copies shall be placed in the employees personnel file 3 suspension violations which are serious in nature but not serious enough to warrant dismissal will be disciplined by suspension an employees refusal to adequately correct previously disciplined action may also result in suspension civil service employees are subject to the provisions listed in appendix d of the city a the department head has the authority to suspend an employee upon consultation with the city administrator or his designee if a situation arises that in the opinion of the supervisor necessitates immediate disciplinary action and the department head is not available the supervisor should notify the city administrator or his designee b the department head will present a memorandum to the employee documenting the rationale for the suspension and its duration a copy of the letter will be placed in the employees personnel file 4 dismissal the department head after consultation with the city administrator or his designee may dismiss any employee with or without notice the department head shall prepare a written dismissal notice enumerating the reasons for the dismissal action the notice will be discussed with the employee during a dismissal conference with the department head in the event dismissal is for continued unsatisfactory performance a written report stating the details of the unsatisfactory performance must be filed by the department head with the city administrator or his designee prior to the issuance of a dismissal notice evidence of the following though not all inclusive may be cause for dismissal a unsatisfactory work performance as determined by the employees supervisor informal evaluations b incompetence negligence or inefficiency in the performance of assigned duties c abusive attitude and language to another employee or the public or abusive conduct resulting in harm or injury to another employee or the public including but not limited to sexual harassment d violation of any lawful or official regulation order or rule or failure to obey any lawful and reasonable direction given by an employees superior provided that such violation or failure to obey amounts to insubordination or a serious breach of discipline which may reasonably be expected to result in lower morale in the organization or to result in loss inconvenience or injury to the city or public e taking for personal use a fee gift or other valuable item during the course of the employees work or in connection with it without reporting its receipt to the supervisor or department head and complying with section b f illegal immoral or indecent conduct g gross negligence or willful or wanton misconduct causing damage to public or private property or waste of public supplies h absence without an authorized leave or failure to report after an authorized leave of absence has expired or has been disapproved revoked or canceled by the employees superior i feigning illness or injury j direct or indirect solicitation andor receipt during working hours of any assessment subscription or contribution for the purpose of electing any candidate to any public office k engaging in any act which endangered the safety health or well being of another person or which is of sufficient magnitude that the consequences cause or act to cause disruption of work or gross discredit to the city l violation of any rule procedure or regulation pertaining to conduct of a city employee m theft or unauthorized possession of city of west chicago property or property of a city employee or resident n falsification of personnel records o possession unless possession is otherwise authorized by virtue of the responsibilities of the employees position use or being under the influence of alcohol controlled substance or narcotics of any kind while performing duties for the city of west chicago p possession unless possession is otherwise authorized by virtue of the responsibilities of the employees position use or being under the influence of alcohol controlled substance or narcotics of any kind while driving a city vehicle or operating city equipment q disclosure of a positive result from any required drug or alcohol test r excessive absenteeism or tardiness s display of other misconduct comparable in seriousness to the offenses enumerated above t false statements either verbal or written  false statements in an employment application will result in immediate discharge  62199   3192001 b  appeal of disciplinary action any nonprobationary employee may appeal a disciplinary action taken by a supervisor or department head the review of an appeal resulting from disciplinary action shall be limited to the facts used in determining whether an incident occurred requiring disciplinary action  and the process used in disciplining the employee once the act occurred 1 the employee within five 5 business days after being notified of the disciplinary action shall request a meeting with the department head or designee and shall submit at such meeting a written statement of appeal outlining the reasons for appealing the action the department head or designee shall then discuss the statement of appeal with the employee 2 the department head or designee within five 5 business days of receipt of the appeal shall meet with the employee and supervisor if applicable and resolve the issue if possible if no resolution can be reached the department head shall forward all related documentation together with a written recommendation to the city administrator or his designee during the next working day following the meeting 3 the city administrator or his designee shall review all related documents and make a decision within ten 10 business days of receipt of the appeal written notice of the final decision shall be given to the employee and the city administrators or his designees decision shall be final 4 the above disciplinary policy is illustrative of guidelines to encourage proper employee behavior and job performance it is neither all inclusive nor is it meant as an absolute procedure and it does not grant any absolute contractual or procedural rights to an employee 5 civil service employees are subject to the provisions detailed in appendix d of the city  62199   3192001 c  grievance procedure a grievance is defined as a complaint arising out of an alleged violation or misinterpretation of the provisions contained in this personnel manual except that any action relating to discipline shall be covered under section b of this article 1 any nonprobationary employees wishing to file a grievance must adhere to the following procedures using the grievance form provided by the city which must accompany each step step one within five 5 business days from the date the employee has knowledge of the condition that gives rise to the grievance he must ask in writing for a meeting with his immediate supervisor the purpose of the meeting is to attempt to resolve the problem without further review the supervisor will arrange a grievance meeting as soon as possible after receiving notice of the employees concern the supervisor shall respond in writing within five 5 business days of the meeting step two if the employee is dissatisfied with the results of the meeting with his immediate supervisor he must submit the grievance in writing to the department head within five 5 business days from the decision of the immediate supervisor the department head will schedule a meeting with the employee within a reasonable time period and review the initial written appeal and the step one response the department head shall respond in writing within five 5 business days of the meeting step three the employee may within ten 10 working days of receipt of the written response from the department head appeal the decision of the department head in writing to the city administrator or his designee the city administrator or his designee will schedule a meeting with the employee within a reasonable time period and review the initial written appeal and the step one and step two responses the city administrator or his designee shall respond in writing within ten 10 business days of the meeting 2 the decision of the city administrator or his designee is final 3 an employee should be aware that circumstances which give rise to a grievance shall not exempt the employee from the responsibility of completing the assigned order task or project or other assigned work  62199   3192001 article viii  administrative policies a  absence from work 1 absence of an employee from duty including the absence for a day or portion thereof that is not authorized or approved shall be deemed to be absence without leave 2 any absence without leave shall be without pay and may be subject to disciplinary action 3 any employee who absents herselfhimself for three 3 consecutive days without leave shall automatically be considered to have resigned  62199   3192001 b  acceptance of gifts 1 city employees are prohibited from virus positive hiv are subject to the citys personnel policies and the benefit plans in effect at that time 2 an employee who is diagnosed as having a catastrophic illness and who desires to continue to work is requested to inform the department head assistant city administrator or city administrator of the diagnosis all medical information pertaining to an employees health will be regarded as privileged private and confidential in most cases no one outside of the positions noted above shall know of the diagnosis and it will only be shared with the positions listed above after consultation with the employee and as permitted by law 3 it is the citys intent to permit an employee with a catastrophic illness to continue to work as long as is reasonable all employment decisions will be based on the merits of the situation in accordance with defined criteria the city will make reasonable accommodations to the employee 4 the citys management staff will be available for private consultation in the event any employee has a concern regarding a contagious catastrophic illness 5 if it becomes generally known that an employee of the city has become infected with a contagious catastrophic coworkers to encourage questions and provide a means to discuss concerns 6 the city administrator or designated representative will handle all external inquiries concerning a contagious catastrophic $50000 an exception would be in a situation where the employee is obviously not a factor in the incident such as the vehicle the employee was driving is struck while not in motion b employee appears based on objective and reasonable criteria to be impaired from the performance of his duties due to the use of alcohol andor drugs two 2 management employees will complete a condition of employee their own approved separate drug and alcohol testing policies that impose more rigorous standards than the policy stated herein in the event this occurs and there exist two 2 apparent conflicting policies the more stringent of the policies will control 4 employees holding a cdl are subject to provisions of the omnibus transportation employee testing act of 1991 5 refusal to submit to testing will result in disciplinary action up to and including termination of employment 6 applicants who refuse to cooperate in or fail to pass a postoffer preemployment drug test will not be hired 7 including termination 9 employees who have been convicted of sentenced for or pled no contest to a drug crime committed on city premises or work sites will be disciplined up to and including termination 10 for the purpose of determining whether the employee is under the influence of alcohol in violation of this policy test results showing an alcohol concentration of 01 or more based upon the grams of alcohol per one hundred 100 millimeters of blood will be considered positive and results showing an alcohol concentration of 0099 or less shall be considered negative  62199   3192001 f  drugalcohol free workplace 1 the manufacture distribution possession or use of any drug while on duty is strictly prohibited for purposes of this policy drugs shall be defined as a any alcohol product  b any drug which is not legally obtainable  c any drug which is legally obtainable such as a prescription drug but which is not legally obtained is not being used for prescribed purposes andor is not being taken according to prescribed dosages 2 it shall be the responsibility of each employee to inform the supervisor department head assistant city administrator or city administrator in the event the employee sees or has reason to believe another employee is in violation of this section 3 this policy does not apply to the lawful use of prescription drugs under the supervision of a licensed health care professional and within the limits of a valid prescription an employee who has been prescribed drugs is required however to consult with his doctor or pharmacist about the prescribed medications effect on the employees ability to perform his job safely and to immediately disclose any medication related work restrictions while employees are required to disclose any medication related work restrictions employees are not required to disclose the type of drugs they have been prescribed or the underlying medical conditions or disabilities unless directed to do so by their doctors or pharmacist or asked to do so by the city 4 compliance with this policy is a condition of employment as a condition of initial or continued employment employees shall abide by the terms of this policy and shall notify the administration department of the city of west chicago of any criminal drug statute conviction guilty or nolo contendere plea for a violation occurring in the workplace no later than five 5 days after such conviction or plea  62199   3192001 g  employee conduct harassment prohibited 1 employees have an obligation to maintain a consistently high standard of conduct in threatening intimidating or hostile acts that relate to race color religion gender national origin age or disability 2 in the event that an employee is confronted by or witnesses an act of harassing city administrator or his designee the city may prohibit any secondary employment request if it is determined that such employment may be detrimental to the best interests of the city 2 a secondary employment request may not be approved a where employment would extend beyond twenty 20 hours per week b where the nature of the work or place of employment might result or encourage a reasonable belief of conflict of interest on the part of the general public c where secondary employment would involve the employees appearance in city uniform or use of city equipment or would foreseeably create liability exposure for the city d where the secondary employment may have an adverse effect on the employees sick leave record or subject them to an unreasonable risk of an injury e where employment involves the use of official information not available to the public f where employment would tend to influence the exercise of impartial judgment on any matter coming before the employee in the course of the performance of the employees duties g where employment involves management of a business closely related to the official work of the employee in these cases the department head and city administrator or his designee may apply restrictions h where it appears that secondary employment impairs the ability to discharge the duties and responsibilities of his city job i where employment is such that the employee would be expected to perform the tasks as part of the employees regular job duties 3 employees who desire secondary employment must complete a secondary employment request form 4 employees who are granted approval for secondary employment do so with the understanding and acceptance that their primary duty obligation and responsibility is to the city employees who are granted approval realize they are subject to call at any time for emergencies special assignment or overtime duty a secondary employment request may be rescinded if in the judgment of the department head and city administrator or his designee the secondary employment is adversely affecting the employees job performance upon termination of the secondary employment the employee shall notify the department head  62199   3192001 w  sexual harassment we are proud of the working environment that has developed at the city of west chicago and it is the purpose of this policy to stress the city of west chicagos strong opposition to sexual harassment and identify the complaint procedures available to employees as well as the disciplinary penalties that could be imposed for sexually harassing conduct or behavior sexual harassment is strictly prohibited by title vii of the civil rights act of 196 as amended in 199 and the illinois human rights act 1 this policy applies to each and every employee officer appointed official agent volunteer vendor and contractor of the city as well as anyone using the citys facilities 2 each supervisormanager is responsible for maintaining the workplace free from sexual harassment this is accomplished by promoting a professional working environment and by dealing with sexual harassment as well as with all other forms of employee misconduct 3 sexual harassment can take several forms sexual harassment is defined as any unwelcome sexual advance or request for sexual favors or any conduct of a sexual nature when a submission to such conduct is made either explicitly or implicitly a term or condition of an individuals employment  b submission to or rejection of such conduct by an individual is used as the basis for employment decisions affecting such individual  or c such conduct has the purpose or effect of substantially interfering with an individuals work performance or creating an intimidating hostile or offensive working environment 4 the courts have determined that sexual harassment is a form of discrimination under title vii of the civil rights act of 196 as amended one 1 example of sexual harassment is where a qualified individual is denied employment opportunities and benefits that are instead awarded to an individual who submits voluntarily or under coercion to sexual advances or sexual favors another example is when an individual must submit to unwelcome sexual conduct in order to receive an employment opportunity conduct commonly considered to be sexual harassment includes but is not limited to the following a verbalsexual innuendos suggestive comments sexual propositions or statements about other employees even outside their presence of a sexual nature suggesting or demanding sexual involvement of another employee whether or not such suggestions or demand is accompanied by implicit or explicit threats concerning ones employment status b nonverbalsuggestive or insulting sounds eg whistling leering obscene gestures sexually suggestive bodily gestures catcalls smacking or kissing noises c visualdisplaying sexually explicit posters signs pinups or slogans of a sexual nature d physicalunwelcome touching hugging or kissing pinching brushing the body in a sexual manner coerced sexual activity or actual sexual assault 5 sexual harassment may involve a a man harassing a woman  b a woman harassing a man  and c harassment between members of the same gender the most severe and overt forms of sexual harassment are easier to determine on the other end of the spectrum some sexual harassment is more subtle and depends to some extent on individual perception and interpretation an example of the most subtle form of sexual harassment is the use of endearments the use of terms such as honey darling and sweetheart is objectionable to many women who believe that these terms undermine their authority and their ability to deal with men on an equal and professional level 6 each individual employee has the responsibility to refrain from sexual harassment in the workplace it is important that employees be sensitive to other employees feelings what may seem like innocent behavior or a joke may not be perceived the same way by another employee it must be understood employees are to conduct themselves in appropriate fashion any employee who sexually harasses a fellow worker can be liable for their actions all employees are expected to become familiar with the contents of this policy and to abide by the requirements it establishes 7 complaint procedure if an employee feels he or she is a victim of sexual harassment it is in the employees best interest to tell the offending person that the behavior is not welcome and must be stopped all incidents of sexual harassment must be reported a report the incident an employee should contact any of the following individuals to report incidents of sexual harassment their department head or the assistant city administrator the report may be made initially either orally or in writing but reports made orally must be placed in writing before an investigation can be initiated b investigation of complaint all complaints of sexual harassment will be handled confidentially and will be thoroughly investigated when a complaint has been submitted in writing the assistant city administrator will initiate an investigation of the suspected sexual harassment within five 5 working days of notification the assistant city administrator may request that another supervisory or management employee of the opposite sex assist in the investigation the investigation will include an interview with the employees who made the initial report the persons towards whom the suspected harassment was directed and the individuals accused of the harassment any other persons who may have information regarding the alleged sexual harassment may also be interviewed c report the assistant city administrator and if applicable the supervisory or management employee of the opposite sex who assisted in the investigation shall prepare a written report within fifteen 15 working days from written notification of the suspected harassment unless extenuating circumstances prevent himthem from doing so the report shall include a finding that sexual harassment occurred sexual harassment has not occurred or there is inconclusive evidence as to whether sexual harassment occurred at the time of the issuance of this report a copy of the report will be given to the employees who made the initial report the employees to whom the suspected harassment was directed and the employees suspected of the harassment 8 any employee who retaliates eg verbal threats intimidation etc against any complaining employee or other person who cooperates with an investigation under this policy shall be subject to discipline up to and including discharge 9 disciplinary and corrective action will be taken against any employee found to have engaged in sexual harassment of any other employee the extent of sanctions may depend in part upon the length and conditions of employment of the particular employee and the nature of the offense the city reserves the right to impose any sanction or combination of sanctions to deal with unreasonable conduct or discrimination 10 corrective action will be taken against any officer official appointed and elected agent volunteer vendor and contractor of the city found to have engaged in sexual harassment of any other employee the city reserves the right to impose any sanction or combination of sanctions to deal with unreasonable conduct or discrimination up to and including termination of any and all working relationships 11 legal rights under the law the city hopes that any incident of sexual harassment can be resolved internal process as outlined above however any employee who believes he has been subjected to sexual harassment has the right to file a complaint with the illinois department of human rights 100 west randolph street chicago illinois 60601 3128146245 andor the equal employment opportunity commission 500 west madison suite 280 chicago illinois 60661 3123532713 the illinois human rights act provides that complaints of harassment must be filed within one hundred eighty 180 days of the alleged incident a complaint with the eeoc must be filed within three hundred 300 days of the alleged incident it is also a violation of section 6101 of the illinois human rights act to retaliate against an employee for opposing or complaining about conduct believed to be in violation of the act  62199   3192001 x  smoke free workplace employees are prohibited from smoking inside any city facility each applicable department shall have at least one objective of the city to ensure the safety and well being of its workforce and the persons with whom the city does business therefore the city has established a zero tolerance policy for any violent acts or threats by or towards any city employee 1 violence in the workplace includes but is not limited to a any physical behavior that involves aggressive physical contact with any other person including pushing hitting fighting throwing objects or otherwise intentionally injuring another person or attempting to injure another person  b any physical behavior that would place a reasonable person in fear of receiving imminent physical injury or other aggressive physical contact of the sort described above  c verbal behavior which involves threatening physical harm either directly or implicitly against any person  and d any act of vandalism or other intentional damage or destruction of city or private property workplace violence also includes instances where such acts or threats are made against an employee by a nonemployee workplace violence does not include activities covered by police department regulations concerning the use of force by members in the performance of their law enforcement duties which are treated separately under the departments policies and procedures 2 employees who become aware of any threat of workplace violence whether by an employee or nonemployee are obligated to immediately report such action to the employees supervisor eg court order against spouse relative or acquaintance the employee may bypass the supervisor and make a complaint directly to the department head assistant city administrator or city administrator employees should not confront the person against whom their complaint is lodged a if the supervisor or department head receives a complaint it shall be their responsibility to notify their supervisor andor the administration department as soon as reasonably possible b all complaints will be given high priority the city administrator may request an investigation of the incident 3 violations of this policy may result in discipline up to and including immediate discharge employees should also understand that such behavior may be criminal and could result in criminal prosecution 4 where an employee reasonably and in good faith opposes or reports any workplace violence or testifies assists or participates in an investigation of or hearing concerning allegations of threats of violence no person or group of persons may retaliate against the employee retaliation includes any act of harassment verbal abuse verbal threats or any other or additional act of workplace violence retaliation will also be considered a violation of this policy and may result in discipline up to and including immediate discharge  62199   3192001 ee  possession of firearms by employees 1 purpose these regulations are applicable to the possession of concealed firearms by licensed employees whenever they are on duty with the city the regulations apply the general restrictions firearms concealed carry act 430 ilcs 661 et seq act to specific requirements and conditions related to a licensed employees performance of his or her city duties as set forth in the findings below a licensed employees possession of a concealed firearm in the performance of certain aspects of his or her duties would violate the act or certain private property rights and accordingly these regulations are intended to prevent such violations and liability to the city therefrom the regulations are not intended to restrict or deny the rights of a licensed employee under the act or under the second amendment of the united states constitution or of the illinois constitution and law pursuant thereto 2 findings the city council of the city of the west chicago hereby finds and determines that a in the event of an emergency or claimed violation of the act involving possession by a licensed employee it is important that the city be able to readily ascertain that the licensed employee is duly licensed under the act accordingly it is proper that the licensed employee provide and the city maintain information on the licensed employees issuance of a license under the act and the renewal suspension and revocation thereof b employees use of city vehicles in carrying out their duties includes driving them onto private property a10 of the act 430 ilcs 6665a10 expressly authorizes an owner of private real property of any kind to prohibit the possession of concealed firearms on property under his or her control and does not require owners of private residential property to post a sign or otherwise provide notice of such while b of the act 430 ilcs 6665b allows a concealed firearm to be stored in a locked vehicle or in a locked container out of plain view in a vehicle in the parking area of most prohibited areas a private property owner has a constitutionally protected common law right to prohibit firearms anywhere on his or her property and this right is not overridden or limited by the second amendments right to bear arms georgiacarryorg inc v georgia  687 f2d 124 12651266 11th cir 2012 also some city vehicles such as motorized carts and construction equipment are not lockable and do not have compartments or other areas where a concealed firearm can be stowed as required by b of the act additionally a licensed employee in many cases has to share a vehicle with a person in the course of his or her duties if the licensed employee has a concealed firearm in the vehicle shared with a person who does not have a concealed carry license and the licensed employee must leave the vehicle and leave the firearm in it a concealed firearm would be left in the possession of a nonlicensed person in violation of the act accordingly it is proper that concealed firearms be prohibited in all city vehicles at all times 3 definitions the following terms in these regulations shall have the meanings stated below act  the firearms concealed carry act 430 ilcs 661 et seq and all amendments thereto enacted and effective after the adoption of these regulations concealed firearm  a concealed firearm as defined in of the act 430 ilcs 665 employee  1 any person employed fulltime or parttime or on a temporary basis by the city  2 any volunteer or person volunteering services or labor to the city fulltime or parttime or on a temporary basis  and 3 any independent contractor of the city or representative of such contractor when performing contractual duties for the city whether on city property or in the field an employee shall not include a police or other peace officer of the city or of another governmental entity when performing duties on behalf of the city licensed employee  an employee having a current valid license under the act city property  any real estate owned leased or licensed to the city or under possession and control of the city except public rightsofway city vehicle  a vehicle of any kind owned leased or in the possession and control of the city or a personal or other vehicle used by a licensed employee for his or her city duties for which use the employee receives or is entitled to receive mileage or other compensation on duty  the time each day that an employee reports for or otherwise begins the performance his or her city duties until the time he or she permanently concludes those duties for the day regardless of whether such duties are begun or concluded on city property however an employee shall not be deemed on duty when on a meal at the times and for the duration provided for in these personnel rules a collective bargaining agreement or other applicable city regulations 4 restrictions on concealed firearms a licensed employees possession of concealed firearms no licensed employee shall possess a concealed firearm when on duty or on city property except in compliance with the act and these regulations further no licensed employee shall possess a concealed firearm while on duty or on city property where allowed by the act unless the licensed employee shall have first notified the city in writing on a form provided by the city that he or she is duly licensed under the act and shall have furnished the city with a photocopy of his or her concealed firearm license such a licensed employee shall also notify the city in writing on a form provided by the city each time his or her concealed firearm license is renewed and shall furnish the city with a photocopy of the renewed license a licensed employee who has notified the city of a concealed firearms license under this subsection shall also notify the city in writing if his or her concealed firearm license is suspended or revoked a licensed employee shall be prohibited from possessing a concealed firearm on duty or on city property until such license is reinstated and the licensed employee shall have provided the city with written notice of such on a form provided by the city and evidence establishing reinstatement which the city may require b city buildings concealed firearms are prohibited in all city buildings in accordance with of the act 430 ilcs 6665 c city vehicles concealed firearms are prohibited in all city vehicles at all times 5 noncompliance violations of these regulations shall subject a licensed employee to disciplinary proceedings under employee conduct and disciplinary procedure of these personnel rules which may result in the suspension or termination of the licensed employee violations of these regulations which are also violations of the act shall be reported to the appropriate law enforcement agency 6 police and other peace officers no part of these regulations shall apply to a police or other peace officer of the city or of another governmental entity 7 interpretation of regulations the regulations in this shall be interpreted to be consistent with the act and a licensed employees right thereunder and under the second amendment of the united states constitution and of the illinois constitution and law pursuant thereto if any provision of these regulations is determined to violate the act other law or the constitutional rights of a licensed employee it shall not affect the validity of other regulations not determined to violate such o0010  2 472014 article ix  separation from city employment a  exit interview 1 any a community antenna television system and whereas division 80 of of the illinois municipal to municipalities general powers over streets and public ways with respect to improvements in connection with shall be as follows footnotes  2  editors note it should be noted that o0096 adopted  provides the current appendix means cable television franchise be restated in its entirety as of this new appendix applied title and purpose title this ordinance shall be known as and may be cited as the city of west chicago cable television franchise  purpose the purpose of this ordinance is to a provide for the franchising and regulation of community antenna television systems and other similar cable communication systems within the city of west chicago  and b provide for the payment of a fee and other valuable consideration to the city of west chicago for the use by a franchisee of city streets and other public ways in the construction and operation of a community antenna television system or other similar cable communication system and to compensate the city of west chicago for costs associated therewith  and c reserved d provide for the development of a community antenna television system or other cable communication system as a means to improve communication between and among the citizens and public institutions of the west chicago community  and e reserved f provide remedies and prescribe penalties for violation of this ordinance of the city of west chicago and the franchise granted hereunder  761982  a 921997 definitions the words and phrases defined in this ordinance shall
